address.description: The DNS address of the endpoint.

clusterIdentifier.description: The cluster identifier of the cluster to access.

port.description: The port number on which the cluster accepts incoming connections.

resourceOwner.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID of the owner of the cluster. This is only required if the cluster is in another Amazon Web Services account.

subnetGroupName.description: The subnet group from which Amazon Redshift chooses the subnet to deploy the endpoint.

vpcEndpoints.description: The connection endpoint for connecting to an Amazon Redshift cluster through the proxy. See details below.

vpcSecurityGroupIds.description: The security group that defines the ports, protocols, and sources for inbound traffic that you are authorizing into your endpoint.

subnetGroupName.description: The subnet group from which Amazon Redshift chooses the subnet to deploy the endpoint.

vpcSecurityGroupIds.description: The security group that defines the ports, protocols, and sources for inbound traffic that you are authorizing into your endpoint.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering EndpointAccess resources.
